content: The discussion on accountability resonated with me. In some cases, managers aren’t setting challenging enough goals. We want to hold people accountable for great results, but we can sometimes set a low bar, or be unclear about what “above and beyond” looks like. People are prone to autonomy and mastery. If we help clear the path via a strong purpose and clear set of goals, they’ll step up. In return, people will notice and be more likely to want to work with that individual. Thanks for the great post!
